entries.meaning: (mining) A person or machine responsible for managing a mineshaft cage.
(dated everywhere, currently Philippines) A basketball player.
examples: In 1946, Athletic Director Chandler reliquished his position as head basketball coach at the school to one of his most proficient former players, Julius Rubin. Despite the fact that Rubin had never coached a cager squad before, he became a well-liked leader for the players assembled to start the 1946-1947 season.

entries.meaning: (cycling, derogatory) A person who drives an automobile, particularly for commuting.
